messages.title: Local campaigner Chris Wilford to fight for Poplar and Limehouse
messages.content: CHRIS WILFORD will be the Conservative Parliamentary Candidate for Poplar and Limehouse in the General Election on Thursday, 8th June 2017.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: No extra developments without more doctors' surgeries, transport links and affordable housing
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Expresses concern over developments and emphasises the need for additional infrastructure and affordable housing.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fight for improvements to local schools
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Advocates for the creation of new schools to support the growing population and ensure high-quality education.
Pledges to tackle anti-social behavior including 'boy racers' and drug pushers.

issues.education: Advocates for between fifteen and twenty new schools to support growing population in Poplar and Limehouse.

housing.content: No extra developments without more doctors' surgeries, transport links and affordable housing.

leaflet.personalStatement: "I have a clear plan for Poplar and Limehouse centred on sustainable development, community relations, lifelong skills and security in work and defence. A vote for Theresa May's Conservatives is one for a brighter, not the past."

endorsements.endorser: Cllr Peter Golds CBE, the leader of the Conservative Group on Tower Hamlets Council

quotes.text: Every vote will count in Poplar and Limehouse. Vote Conservative on Thursday, 8th June 2017 to strengthen Theresa May's hand to get the best deal for Britain.

images.caption: Chris Wilford standing near a school sign.
Chris Wilford's plan on tackling anti-social behavior.
Chris Wilford with Theresa May and other supporters.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Chris Wilford previously stood in 2015 and was the Conservative candidate for Mayor of Tower Hamlets.
